slamR 0.2.2
  • Reference

Reference

All functions

adg_em()

Estimate Q, screening latent attributes (Alternating Gibbs)

bin2ind()

convert binary codes to decimal integers

binary()

convert decimal integers to binary codes

bsxfun_7_hinge_pow()

7 shaped binary array operation by bsxfun from matlab but with "hinge" shape

bsxfun_7_hinge_pow_prod()

7 shaped binary array operation by bsxfun from matlab but with "hinge" shape; multiple along dimension d2

bsxfun_7_pow()

7 shaped binary array operation by bsxfun from matlab

check_complete()

check if matrix Q is complete

check_overlap()

check if patterns in A1 match those in A2

f()

flip the matrix to the right form for image()

generate_X_DINA()

simulate data according to DINA

generate_X_fromA()

generate simulated data A

generate_X_tax2()

generate second-level responses with taxonomy under DINA

get_EM()

function to actually perform EM for DINA (fixed A)

get_I()

get none, singleton, doubleton, ... until full binary patterns

get_PEM()

PEM FOR SHRINKAGE - this is to take a candidate latent attribute set

get_em_classify()

EM algorithm for estimating c, g and mixing parameter pi

get_ideal_resp()

get ideal response for DINA

get_ideal_resp_R()

get ideal response for DINA R

get_initial_n()

get initial Q and Z

get_initial_s()

get initial Q and Z

get_rp()

calculates marginal probabilities of all the 2^J possible response patterns

log_prac()

log with log(0) being 0

make_list()

Takes any number of R objects as arguments and returns a list whose names are derived from the names of the R objects.

nchoosek_prac()

n choose k - dealing with large values.

perform_shrink()

performs shrinkage estimation and use Extended BIC (EBIC) to select the best tuning parameter in the penalized likelihood from an entire solution path

reconstruct()

reconstructs N by J data matrix using the estimated item parameters c, g and other quantities

rvbern()

Sample a vector of Bernoulli variables.

slamR

slamR: structured latent attribute models inR

sort_binmat()

order binary matrix by row

unique_sort_binmat()

unique and ordered binary matrix by row
